title: List of fatal dog attacks in the United States
data: The man died after suffering bites to his head and left arm from his son 's dog . He was taking down a Christmas tree when the dog attacked him

Playing on his family 's porch when the family 's two dogs attacked . His grandfather tried to pull the dogs off , but when the ambulance arrived , he was already dead . Before the attack , the two dogs had played with Declan since they were puppies and they had never shown any aggression . After the attack , the two dogs were removed by animal control

Playing in his yard with the six-month-old dogs - a 25-pound female and a 35-pound male - as he had done with no problems since they were small puppies . There were no witnesses ; relatives came outside and found him unresponsive . The dogs stood calmly by while EMTs tried to revive him . They were calm and friendly as they were taken away until they along with the family 's third dog were put down , just as they had reportedly always been with everyone before the attack . When his father sold their litter-mates , he described them as pitbull English bulldog-types . Malaki was pronounced dead 50 minutes after the attack . No charges were filed
Found dead by a family member

The family had been staying with the residents for days and the dog had shown no sign of aggression . At about 8:45 p.m. the dog suddenly bit her face and shook her , killing her very quickly . She was pronounced dead at the hospital ; the dog was euthanized , and no charges were filed

Victim was killed while trying to revive his roommate , the dog 's owner , from a heart attack . A woman who witnessed the attack was found hiding from the dog on the roof . The dog was not registered with the city , despite ordinance requiring all pit bulls in the city be registered . Both men were pronounced dead at a local hospital . The dog was ultimately sent to a Pennsylvania rescue

Found dead by her daughter in the home where she lived alone . Investigation concluded she had been killed by the dog that she had owned for five years . The dog was scheduled to be destroyed and tested for rabies
The woman was attacked early in the morning near her property . The sheriff arrived and shot and killed the dogs

Arrived at a garage for a car repair appointment , when seven guard dogs got under the fence and attacked him . He ran and got on the roof of his car , but was not saved . Police arrived and tazed a dog , but it had no effect , so he shot it dead . Animal control tried a tranquilizer gun on another , but that failed , so three more were shot dead , one escaped , and animal control captured and euthanized two . Before the attack , reports had been filed with the police about the dogs . After the attack , the escaped dog returned to the garage , showed aggression towards a deputy and was shot . An eighth dog found on the property that had not participated in the attack was captured . The owner pleaded guilty to a felony manslaughter charge on April 1 , 2016
The woman 's body was found in a ditch and autopsy determined she had died from a dog attack

The victim went to his neighbor 's two-home property to feed his cats when a tenant 's three dogs jumped the six foot fence and attacked him . Two men ran to help the screaming victim and the dogs attacked them . The men were able to drag the victim next door and close the gate , but the pit bulls found a hole in the fence and resumed the attack . The dogs had chewed off the victim 's left hand and his face , leaving an eye hanging out . One of the men got a gun and shot two of the three pit bulls , but the dogs continued attacking , undeterred , until police and EMS arrived , at which point the dogs fled . Authorities arrested the dogs ' owner immediately . The victim was airlifted to a hospital in critical condition and died a month later . Both assisting men were seriously injured ; one spent 23 days in hospital . The three dogs were caught and put down . The dogs had a history of aggression and being at large . Ricky Davidson , 40 , tenant of the neighbor 's house , pleaded guilty to one count of reckless endangerment , a gross misdemeanor . Davidson was sentenced to 364 days in jail in connection to the death of Kenneth Ford . The sentence also included other dog-related and drug-related charges against Davidson that were bundled together in plea negotiations

Victim was killed by his family 's dog . The child was sitting in a bouncing seat while the parents were outside . The victim 's two older siblings had grown up playing and sleeping with the 8-year old dog . The father shot the dog after the incident
Mauled to death by up to five dogs while visiting friends

Victim was mauled to death by his girlfriend 's dog which allegedly assisted the victim when he had epileptic seizures . The dog , however , had previously attacked the victim four times , injuring both ears . Three of those incidents were reported

Boy was killed by his cousin 's dog while visiting his home . The cousin was not at home at the time of the attack . The dog latched onto the boy 's throat and the child 's mother dragged the dog and child outside to get help . Several witnesses intervened and beat the dog with sticks and bricks and also stabbed it , trying to get the dog to let go of the boy . Once the dog let go , they beat the dog to death . The cousin was cited with two tickets for not having the dog inoculated for rabies and not having a city license
Killed by dog while under the care of his babysitter . The dog fatally bit the boy 's throat . Police said the child had been around the dog before without any problems

Victim was attacked and killed by three dogs belonging to his daughter 's next door neighbor while feeding his daughter 's Labrador Retriever . The neighbor 's dogs somehow entered into the backyard and began attacking Legarda and the Labrador . When police arrived , the dogs were still attacking the Labrador and a man was lying in the backyard . Police had to pepper spray and Taser the pit bulls to reach the injured man . Shortly thereafter , Legarda was pronounced dead

Killed by a dog belonging to his neighbor , who had adopted the neutered male pit bull from the Asheville Humane Society three weeks earlier . The attack occurred after Joshua climbed the fence to enter his neighbor 's yard . Joshua had been climbing over the fence to visit the dog since its arrival , as well to play with his neighbor 's young daughter

Attacked and killed by a dog that had escaped from the back yard just after she exited her car in a residential neighborhood . Annie was picking up her two great granddaughters from a home in Shaker Heights , where they were with their father , when the dog belonging to someone living in the home attacked her in the driveway . The dog 's owner pleaded guilty to involuntary manslaughter and was sentenced to 30 months in prison . His mother pleaded guilty to negligent homicide and received a six-month suspended jail sentence

The victim was killed by up to four dogs . Witnesses said she was walking down South Main Street in the small town of Redbird when the animals attacked . One man chased the dogs away , but it was too late . The dogs attacked the woman 's face and ripped off all of her clothing . Witnesses said she was left unrecognizable . She died on scene
